member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationManager
member.summary: Exposes the Http.Sys authentication configurations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationManager.Schemes
member.summary: When attaching to an existing queue this setting must match the one used to create the queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationManager.AllowAnonymous
member.summary: Indicates if anonymous requests will be surfaced to the application or challenged by the server. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationManager.AutomaticAuthentication
member.summary: If true the server should set HttpContext.User. If false the server will only provide an identity when explicitly requested by the AuthenticationScheme. The default is true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationManager.AuthenticationDisplayName
member.summary: Sets the display name shown to users on login pages. The default is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationSchemes
member.summary: Specifies protocols for authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationSchemes.None
member.summary: No authentication is enabled. This should only be used when HttpSysOptions.Authentication.AllowAnonymous is enabled (see ).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationSchemes.Basic
member.summary: Specifies basic authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationSchemes.NTLM
member.summary: Specifies NTLM authentication.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationSchemes.Negotiate
member.summary: Negotiates with the client to determine the authentication scheme. If both client and server support Kerberos, it is used; otherwise, NTLM is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AuthenticationSchemes.Kerberos
member.summary: Specifies Kerberos authentication.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.ClientCertificateMethod
member.summary: Describes the client certificate negotiation method for HTTPS connections.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.ClientCertificateMethod.NoCertificate
member.summary: A client certificate will not be populated on the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.ClientCertificateMethod.AllowCertificate
member.summary: A client certificate will be populated if already present at the start of a request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.ClientCertificateMethod.AllowRenegotation
member.summary: The TLS session can be renegotiated to request a client certificate.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.DelegationRule
member.summary: Rule that maintains a handle to the Request Queue and UrlPrefix to delegate to.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.DelegationRule.QueueName
member.summary: The name of the Http.Sys request queue

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.DelegationRule.UrlPrefix
member.summary: The URL of the Http.Sys Url Prefix

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Helpers.GetChunkHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: A private utility routine to convert an integer to a chunk header, which is an ASCII hex number followed by a CRLF.The header is returned as a byte array. Generates a right-aligned hex string and returns the start offset.
member.param: Chunk size to be encoded
member.returns: A byte array with the header in int.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel
member.summary: Enum declaring the allowed values for the verbosity level when http.sys reject requests due to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel.Basic
member.summary: A 503 response is not sent; the connection is reset. This is the default HTTP Server API behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel.Limited
member.summary: The HTTP Server API sends a 503 response with a "Service Unavailable" reason phrase.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Http503VerbosityLevel.Full
member.summary: The HTTP Server API sends a 503 response with a detailed reason phrase.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysDefaults
member.summary: Constants for HttpSys.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysDefaults.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: The name of the authentication scheme used.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysException
member.summary: Exception thrown by HttpSys when an error occurs

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysListener
member.summary: An HTTP server wrapping the Http.Sys APIs that accepts requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysListener.Start
member.summary: Start accepting incoming requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysListener.Dispose
member.summary: Stop the server and clean up.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysListener.AcceptAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.AsyncAcceptContext)
member.summary: Accept a request from the incoming request queue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions
member.summary: Contains the options used by HttpSys.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.RequestQueueName
member.summary: The name of the Http.Sys request queue

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.RequestQueueMode
member.summary: Indicates if this server instance is responsible for creating and configuring the request queue, of if it should attach to an existing queue. The default is to create.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.ClientCertificateMethod
member.summary: Indicates how client certificates should be populated. The default is to allow a certificate without renegotiation. This does not change the netsh 'clientcertnegotiation' binding option which will need to be enabled for ClientCertificateMethod.AllowCertificate to resolve a certificate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.MaxAccepts
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of concurrent workers draining requests from the Http.sys queue.
member.remarks: Defaults to 5 times the number of processors as returned by .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.EnableResponseCaching
member.summary: Attempts kernel mode caching for responses with eligible headers. The response may not include Set-Cookie, Vary, or Pragma headers. It must include a Cache-Control header with Public and either a Shared-Max-Age or Max-Age value, or an Expires header.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.UrlPrefixes
member.summary: The url prefixes to register with Http.Sys. These may be modified at any time prior to disposing the listener. When attached to an existing queue the prefixes are only used to compute PathBase for requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.Authentication
member.summary: Http.Sys authentication settings. These may be modified at any time prior to disposing the listener.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.Timeouts
member.summary: Exposes the Http.Sys timeout configurations. These may also be configured in the registry. These may be modified at any time prior to disposing the listener. These settings do not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.ThrowWriteExceptions
member.summary: Gets or Sets if response body writes that fail due to client disconnects should throw exceptions or complete normally. The default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.MaxConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent connections to accept, -1 for infinite, or null to use the machine wide setting from the registry. The default value is null. This settings does not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.RequestQueueLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of requests that will be queued up in Http.Sys. This settings does not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.MaxRequestBodySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed size of any request body in bytes. When set to null, the maximum request body size is unlimited. This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited. This can be overridden per-request via .
member.remarks: Defaults to 30,000,000 bytes, which is approximately 28.6MB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.AllowSynchronousIO
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether synchronous IO is allowed for the HttpContext.Request.Body and HttpContext.Response.Body. The default is `false`.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.Http503Verbosity
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls how http.sys reacts when rejecting requests due to throttling conditions - like when the request queue limit is reached. The default in http.sys is "Basic" which means http.sys is just resetting the TCP connection. IIS uses Limited as its default behavior which will result in sending back a 503 - Service Unavailable back to the client. This settings does not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.UnsafePreferInlineScheduling
member.summary: Inline request processing instead of dispatching to the threadpool.
member.remarks: Enabling this setting will run application code on the IO thread to reduce request processing latency. However, this will limit parallel request processing to . This setting can make overall throughput worse if requests take long to process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.HttpSysOptions.UseLatin1RequestHeaders
member.summary: Configures request headers to use encoding.
member.remarks: Defaults to `false`, in which case will be used. />.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.IHttpSysRequestDelegationFeature
member.summary: Interface for delegating requests to other Http.Sys request queues.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.IHttpSysRequestDelegationFeature.CanDelegate
member.summary: Indicates if the server can delegate this request to another HttpSys request queue.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.IHttpSysRequestDelegationFeature.DelegateRequest(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.DelegationRule)
member.summary: Attempt to delegate the request to another Http.Sys request queue. The request body must not be read nor the response started before this is invoked. Check before invoking.
member.param: The rule maintaining the handle to the destination queue.

member.summary: This exposes the Http.Sys HTTP_REQUEST_INFO extensibility point as opaque data for the caller to interperate. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_v2 https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/http/ns-http-http_request_info

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.IHttpSysRequestInfoFeature.RequestInfo
member.summary: A collection of the HTTP_REQUEST_INFO for the current request. The integer represents the identifying HTTP_REQUEST_INFO_TYPE enum value. The Memory is opaque bytes that need to be interperted in the format specified by the enum value.

member.summary: This exposes the creation of delegation rules on request queues owned by the server.

The URL of the Http.Sys Url Prefix.
member.returns: Creates a that can used to delegate individual requests.

member.summary: True if this instace created the queue instead of attaching to an existing one.

member.summary: Contains helpers for dealing with TLS token binding.

member.summary: Returns the 'provided' token binding identifier, optionally also returning the 'referred' token binding identifier. Returns null on failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.RequestContext.Dispose
member.summary: Flushes and completes the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.RequestContext.Abort
member.summary: Forcibly terminate and dispose the request, closing the connection if necessary.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Response.AuthenticationChallenges
member.summary: The authentication challenges that will be added to the response if the status code is 401. This must be a subset of the AuthenticationSchemes enabled on the server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Response.CacheTtl
member.summary: Enable kernel caching for the response with the given timeout. Http.Sys determines if the response can be cached.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.Response.HasStarted
member.summary: Indicates if the response status, reason, and headers are prepared to send and can no longer be modified. This is caused by the first write or flush to the response body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.RequestQueueMode
member.summary: Used to indicate if this server instance should create a new Http.Sys request queue or attach to an existing one.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.RequestQueueMode.Create
member.summary: Create a new queue. This will fail if there's an existing queue with the same name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.RequestQueueMode.Attach
member.summary: Attach to an existing queue with the name given. This will fail if the queue does not already exist. Most configuration options do not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.RequestQueueMode.CreateOrAttach
member.summary: Create a queue with the given name if it does not already exist, otherwise attach to the existing queue. Most configuration options do not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager
member.summary: Exposes the Http.Sys timeout configurations. These may also be configured in the registry. These settings do not apply when attaching to an existing queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.EntityBody
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the request entity body to arrive. The default timer is 2 minutes.
The HTTP Server API turns on this timer when the request has an entity body. The timer expiration is initially set to the configured value. When the HTTP Server API receives additional data indications on the request, it resets the timer to give the connection another interval.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.DrainEntityBody
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the HTTP Server API to drain the entity body on a Keep-Alive connection. The default timer is 2 minutes.
On a Keep-Alive connection, after the application has sent a response for a request and before the request entity body has completely arrived, the HTTP Server API starts draining the remainder of the entity body to reach another potentially pipelined request from the client. If the time to drain the remaining entity body exceeds the allowed period the connection is timed out.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.RequestQueue
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the request to remain in the request queue before the application picks it up. The default timer is 2 minutes.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.IdleConnection
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for an idle connection. The default timer is 2 minutes.
This timeout is only enforced after the first request on the connection is routed to the application.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.HeaderWait
member.summary:
The time, in seconds, allowed for the HTTP Server API to parse the request header. The default timer is 2 minutes.
This timeout is only enforced after the first request on the connection is routed to the application.
Use TimeSpan.Zero to indicate that system defaults should be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.TimeoutManager.MinSendBytesPerSecond
member.summary:
The minimum send rate, in bytes-per-second, for the response. The default response send rate is 150 bytes-per-second.
Use 0 to indicate that system defaults should be used.
To disable this timer set it to UInt32.MaxValue

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.UrlPrefix
member.summary: A set of URL parameters used to listen for incoming requests.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.HttpSys.UrlPrefix.Create(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa364698(v=vs.85).aspx
member.param: http or https. Will be normalized to lower case.
+, *, IPv4, [IPv6], or a dns name. Http.Sys does not permit punycode (xn--), use Unicode instead.
If empty, the default port for the given scheme will be used (80 or 443).
Should start and end with a '/', though a missing trailing slash will be added. This value must be un-escaped.

Should start and end with a '/', though a missing trailing slash will be added. This value must be un-escaped.

devdoc.para: This class is used when subclassing EndPoint, and provides indication on how to format the memory buffers that winsock uses for network addresses.

member.summary: Unescape a given path string in place. The given path string may contain escaped char.
member.param: The raw path string to be unescaped

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.DecodeCore(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Unescape the percent-encodings
member.param: The iterator point to the first % char
The place to write to
The end of the buffer
The byte array

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.UnescapePercentEncoding(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary:
Read the percent-encoding and try unescape it.
The operation first peek at the character the iterator points at. If it is % the is then moved on to scan the following to characters. If the two following characters are hexadecimal literals they will be unescaped and the value will be returned.
If the first character is not % the iterator will be removed beyond the location of % and -1 will be returned.
If the following two characters can't be successfully unescaped the iterator will be move behind the % and -1 will be returned.
member.param: The value to read
The end of the buffer
The byte array
member.returns: The unescaped byte if success. Otherwise return -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.ReadHex(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary:
Read the next char and convert it into hexadecimal value.
The iterator will be moved to the next byte no matter no matter whether the operation successes.
member.param: The value to read
The end of the buffer
The byte array
member.returns: The hexadecimal value if successes, otherwise -1.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.summary: This default value passed in to Rent to use the default value for the pool.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock
member.summary: Block tracking object used by the byte buffer memory pool. A slab is a large allocation which is divided into smaller blocks. The individual blocks are then treated as independent array segments.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock._pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.summary: This object cannot be instantiated outside of the static Create method

member.summary: Wraps an array allocated in the pinned object heap in a reusable block of managed memory

member.name: P:System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock.Pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._blockSize
member.summary: The size of a block. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems use 4k pages.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Max allocation block size for pooled blocks, larger values can be leased but they will be disposed after use rather than returned to the pool.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.BlockSize
member.summary: The size of a block. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems use 4k pages.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._blocks
member.summary: Thread-safe collection of blocks which are currently in the pool. A slab will pre-allocate all of the block tracking objects and add them to this collection. When memory is requested it is taken from here first, and when it is returned it is re-added.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._isDisposed
member.summary: This is part of implementing the IDisposable pattern.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.AnySize
member.summary: This default value passed in to Rent to use the default value for the pool.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.Return(System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock)
member.summary: Called to return a block to the pool. Once Return has been called the memory no longer belongs to the caller, and Very Bad Things will happen if the memory is read of modified subsequently. If a caller fails to call Return and the block tracking object is garbage collected, the block tracking object's finalizer will automatically re-create and return a new tracking object into the pool. This will only happen if there is a bug in the server, however it is necessary to avoid leaving "dead zones" in the slab due to lost block tracking objects.
member.param: The block to return. It must have been acquired by calling Lease on the same memory pool instance.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm
member.summary: Provides support for efficiently using Tasks to implement the APM (Begin/End) pattern.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.Begin(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Marshals the Task as an IAsyncResult, using the supplied callback and state to implement the APM pattern.
member.param: The Task to be marshaled.
The callback to be invoked upon completion.
The state to be stored in the IAsyncResult.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult to represent the task's asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.End(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Processes an IAsyncResult returned by Begin.
member.param: The IAsyncResult to unwrap.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.End``1(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Processes an IAsyncResult returned by Begin.
member.param: The IAsyncResult to unwrap.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult
member.summary: Provides a simple IAsyncResult that wraps a Task.
member.remarks: We could use the Task as the IAsyncResult if the Task's AsyncState is the same as the object state, but that's very rare, in particular in a situation where someone cares about allocation, and always using TaskAsyncResult simplifies things and enables additional optimizations.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult._task
member.summary: The wrapped Task.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult._callback
member.summary: Callback to invoke when the wrapped task completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Object,System.AsyncCallback)
member.summary: Initializes the IAsyncResult with the Task to wrap and the associated object state.
member.param: The Task to wrap.
The new AsyncState value.
Callback to invoke when the wrapped task completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.InvokeCallback
member.summary: Invokes the callback.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.AsyncState
member.summary: Gets a user-defined object that qualifies or contains information about an asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.CompletedSynchronously
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the asynchronous operation completed synchronously.
member.remarks: This is set lazily based on whether the has completed by the time this object is created.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the asynchronous operation has completed.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: Gets a that is used to wait for an asynchronous operation to complete.
